intro: Pharmacosycea jamaicensis, commonly known as Jamaican fever vine, is a climbing shrub native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, spherical berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its potential medicinal properties, it has been studied for its possible applications in traditional medicine.
